body:
I know it's RSpec-like (heh) but #has? may make more sense than #in? However, I find myself stuck on the negative case as well.
On Sunday, April 10, 2011 at 2:26 PM, dhh wrote: 
> elight, all is good. Three cheers for the expressive nature of Ruby and for matz allowing us so graciously to follow in his footsteps and further enrich the dialect that is ActiveSupport.
> 
> bcardarella, "object in array?" is how #in? reads and that makes sense. "object out array?" makes no sense.
> 
> -- 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/258#issuecomment-981157
>
